thread.title: Senza chef Sandoval to open Oriole in West Loop
thread.title_full: Senza chef Sandoval to open Oriole in West Loop - Chicago Tribune

author: Phil Vettel
title: Senza chef Sandoval to open Oriole in West Loop
text:
Noah Sandoval and Genie Kwon, two highly regarded Chicago chefs, will team up to open Oriole, in the West Loop, toward the end of the year.
Sandoval, last seen running the Michelin-star-rated Senza (which closed in January), and Kwon, who led the pastry programs for Boka and GT Fish & Oyster (and was this year's Jean Banchet Awards' Rising Pastry Chef of the Year) will be joined by Cara Sandoval, Noah's wife, who will run the front of the house.
"I was going to name (the restaurant) after her," Noah Sandoval said, "but it might be weird, since she'll be there every day. My wife is from Baltimore, and she really likes the Orioles, so ..."
Hey, at least it's not Cardinal.
The 28-seater will be open Tuesday to Saturday, and will offer a single tasting menu ranging from 15 to 20 courses. Customers will be offered two beverage pairings, one that will include cocktails, wine, beer and perhaps cider, and a somewhat more expensive, all-wine pairing.
Sandoval will be joined in the kitchen by two former sous chefs at Senza. "We've got a good team already," he said.
Oriole's food will represent a natural extension of Sandoval's work at Senza, he says, with one important difference. Senza was strictly a gluten-free restaurant; Oriole will have abundant gluten-free options and other dietary accommodations, but will not be strictly gluten-free.
Sandoval is keeping mum on Oriole's exact location, except to say it'll be in the West Loop. "It's a unique location," he said. "In the middle of everything, while not in the middle."
The goal is to have Oriole open before the end of the year, but Sandoval is realistic about the delays that can occur.
"Whenever it opens," he said, "it'll be really cold out."
Phil Vettel is a Tribune critic
